intro: Monelasmum contractum, commonly known as the narrowleaf monelasmum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and Georgia. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of pale yellow to greenish-white flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Monelasmum contractum is often found in wetlands and along the edges of ponds, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
